reviews.review_msg: Rubric was little to no explanation and SUBJECTIVE. Prof would take off marks for reasons not stated in outline. Questions met with I cant give you the answer. Even if answers were pulled straight from lecture materials, marks taken off for unknown unanswered reasons. Talks about nothing for 90% of lectures then one sentence that will impact grade.

Never before in my life have I experienced rubrics as vague as the ones in 355. On multiple occasions, I got lab questions marked wrong, with the only feedback being "almost" (??). I'm not sure how I can possibly do better/actually learn with that little feedback or a solid rubric to work off. 

Don't take this class.

Brutal professor. midterm average was a C and she decided to make the final the same format. Labs and assignments were graded by the TA and she marked us like we were professional cartographers. Long lectures of useless material with unrealistic standards. Avoid this class at all costs if you can.

Unfair marker, not structured in her grading. Condescending. She said she wants to know that we understood in our answers, but she should be marking on our answers, not on whether or not we could convince her of our understanding. She can't possibly know that, and we couldn't possibly get that across the way she was expecting us to. Avoid her.

Has not transitioned to online lectures very well. Most slides are just images with zero context. Labs were the best part of the course only because we had a great TA, Stella. All the midterms had to be regraded because she did not communicate with students or TA the expectations for each question, so midterm average dropped about 10%

Nadine is very knowledgeable and passionate about GIS. Midterm is super easy, I studied the night before but ended up over studying. You need to take notes on what she says in class. Labs are easy but take a long time to do. She is a bit rude to her students compared to all GIS profs and sometimes its hard to understand what she wants you to know.

Im really enjoying lecture with her. Shes very knowledgeable and delivers information really well. The labs coincided for the most part with the lecture. Exams are straightforward but do have information that will not be in the lecture slides. Definitely attend class in order to do well. Textbooks were recommended not required.

I love Nadine. It's clear she has a lot of knowledge on and cares about what shes teaching. But, THE LABS ARE SO HARD. so hard :( The labs are not worth the great class and if I could still drop it I would. Not because of Nadine, but because of the labs.
YOU WILL NEVER KNOW HER WHICH PART SHOULD BE FOCUS IN LECTURE. TOO HARD TO STUDY WITH HER
No Comments

I liked this prof but could not connect with the teaching style. She took an absolute unapologetic disintrest in the lab portion of the course so the course is hit and miss depending on the quality of the TA. **LOTS** of lab time...expext some 24 hrs days.
No Comments
No Comments

His final was extremely hard however most of the course was graded by assignments and weekly quizzes. The assignments were marked fairly imo and made most of my grade. The quizzes were just 4 questions based on the weeks lecture. He has a dry sense of humor which makes lectures entertaining. Would easily take another class with him.
Always respond on the email. Really quick responder and understanding. I have take 3 courses with Shiv and he was amazing and very helpful professor.

1. Shrink lectures and gives audio record for students that cannot be there.
 2. Responsible and treat you like an adult with a respectful attitude. Wonderful and positive person.
 3. Always being helpful and even replied to emails on Sunday within 10mins, twice.
 4. Extend deadlines very often when only a few people cannot make it.

Shiv is not interested in teaching students or supporting them in being successful in this course. He defaults on what students should have learned in GEOG255, however, 355 covers entirely new GIS subject area and software. Assignments given require you to mostly google teach yourself, on top of given readings, exercises and lectures.

This professor is absolutely awful. He doesn't teach. I have never had a professor rely more on students' ability to "just google it". Only take his courses if you can entirely teach it to yourself. He says to rely on "previous experience" while teaching an entirely new (to most students) software that was not a pre-requisite in GEOG 255.
ABSOLUTE BEAUTY. Would take any course with this gem.
One of the best classes ever. You gotta take at least one course with this prof to feel what good teaching and learning is like. Thanks Dr Shiv!
Great class! The prof sometimes give 2 hrs of engaging lectures from just 2 powerpoint slides! That's a remarkable feat. Amazing prof. Hope he is not leaving...

He has high expectations, but marks fairly, as long as you understand the content. Assignment questions always seem hard, but after answering them you feel smarter. Same with the final project, you gotta figure stuff out yourself. Final is always tough. Sad to hear he's leaving soon.

I transferred into SFU and decided to take GIS. Prof went out of his way to help me get into the course. The lectures are awesome! and he genuinely cares about his students. Totally glad I am taking this course.
Shivanand is always wiling to offer advice and support. A great mentor. He asks unanswerable questions in class to stimulate discussion - don't get frustrated, just bear with it!
Excellent course!
GIS II is one of the best classes I took in a long while. I didn't like the late afternoon lecture slot, but the prof is super good....

He is very clear, and appears interested in the subject; good lecturer, but his exams are hard, and not always truly reflective of what was stressed in lecture. Beware the calculation questions - he does not give examples in class - learn HOW TO USE ALL formulas discussed in class (this will have to be on your own since he does not go over them)

Hilarious guy, thorough teacher, extremely friendly, and very helpful when you need extra help.  An all round good prof.  I don't even like GIS too much, but I took the second GIS course due to him teaching it.  It is fairly hard to come by good profs.

Amazing prof. He was extremely helpful and he is very knowledgeable. Always encouraged questions and did his best to make sure people understood the material. He didn't try and cover too much material in class and did a great job explaining the material he did present. His tests were quite difficult but the class was still great.
Fantastic professor. Very clear and concise during his lectures and always willing to help you out. Would definitely recommend.
Tough grading.

Pros: Easy marker, short lectures, great in labs Cons: soooooo slow in marking and responding to emails. This class is SO HARD! You won't get a good grade without putting the effort in. There's a lot of homework and the assignments are time consuming but Aateka was great with giving extensions and really wants her students to succeed!
Only upload video on time for the first two weeks, then they are delayed or even no video uploaded. We've been studying on our own the whole semester

She is helpful when we ask her qs but more like a TA, not a prof. The assignment: She doesn't know if it is doable, she just writes the assignment without a doable test, she even has trouble doing it on her own. She told us "this is GIS" but we don't want a boss like prof to grade us when she does not fully understand the question she gives out.

Her tests require you to know every concept and be able to apply them to different scenarios. Don't expect to just memorize anything. Labs are based off textbook exercises that take forever. Her grading is tough; I got 5% deductions for minor things like symbols too small or two colours not contrast enough. Also, her instructions are never clear.

One of the worst instructors Ive dealt with at SFU. Lack of communication between her and her TA's. Lack of direction for studying for exams, no outlines for which material to study etc., tries to be relatable during lectures but doesn't fully explain material being presented, mostly just reads what is said in the notes. Hard marker!
